dataList.content: We found more of the condemned of Hongyuan in this room, who were in a similar state as the ones above.
Draped around their necks were more coins.
Forgive us... Forgive us... Forgive us... Forgive us...
The bloody lunatics who came up with this shite... and the deviants who consume it... They're all fucked in the head. All of 'em.
These poor people are all barely conscious.
... Yet these terrible markings on the wall...
... tell a tragic tale of those who desperately desired to escape here.
Putting prisoners who've been experimented on like some pawns in a game—no, even experimenting on humans at all, it's—
—It's so very common in the City. We don't need to look very far, do we? The same thing happened at your manor.
I... detest that we are behooved to purloin the coins by bringing them harm.
They harbor us no ill will when they attack us, they are all merely...
Don Quixote did not finish her sentence, but we all knew what she wanted to say.
These prisoners are not monsters, Distortions, or even Abnormalities. They're...
They're just people. Exploited and experimented on by the great houses.
Don Quixote now knows that the world is not as black-and-white as she used to think. But...
... I doubt she could simply turn away from all this injustice without it leaving a bad taste in her mouth.
How could she, when the prisoners and we were all treated like nothing but entertainment...
... for the spectators watching us from so high up? When all of this was just to select the Family Hierarch?
